outline.text: The problem
When attempting something difficult, there is discomfort
Distraction is a way to avoid or delay discomfort
Distracting behavior tends to be -
- easy, not confusing
- something I can control and succeed at
- non-productive
- may be productive but not urgent - do it later
- addicting
How do I stay focused on a difficult task when escaping is so easy?
Notice the details
How does distraction emerge in you?
Notice the craving for the distracting behavior
Look for the emotion and/or discomfort that precedes the distraction
Such as anxiety, feeling restless, feeling incompetent, craving something
Take notes. Use Distraction Tracker sheet
Be a witness - "I feel a familiar tension in my chest. And I want to click on CNN."
Do you experience a cycle of resisting, ruminating, and finally giving in to a desire?
Ten minute rule
It's dangerous to do some unhelpful behavior "just for a second"
I can do the thing but only after I wait ten minutes.
During the ten minutes, notice your sensations and ride them like a wave
Don't push anything away and also don't act on anything
Watch the craving as it crests and subsides
Imagine leaves floating down a stream. Place your thought on a leaf and let it float away, swirling in the current.
What's interesting here?
Approach a familiar situation with fresh eyes, curiosity, creativity, humor
Pay full attention to find variability and challenges you didn't see before
Pay close, foolish, even absurd attention to your task
Learn new things about it, transform it into an imaginary playground.
What is interesting about it that you didn't notice before?
Find some aspect of the task that your mind can get hooked into
Pose interesting questions
Look for new solutions to old problems
What is mysterious about this? What do I want to know about this? What am I curious about?
Look for variability and novelty
Do the task to a higher standard of excellence
Example - Mowing the lawn
How can I mow the lawn more efficiently?
What is the optimum path for the mower?
Look for the interesting constraints
Can you beat your record time?
Understand how the grass grows and how to help it grow
Will power
You don't run out of will power
It does ebb and flow but it's not out of control
You don't run out of calmness or excitement, likewise will power
Is there a method to maximize will power?
Lack of motivation is temporary
Define your values
What vibration do you want to give to the world?
What do you want to stand for?
How do you want to relate to the world?
What are the attributes of the person you want to be?
Create a schedule that includes activities aligned with your values
